title: In These Connecticut Cities, Air Quality Has Reached Unhealthy Levels
description: In These Connecticut Cities, air quality shows elevated AQI levels as PM2.5 remains the primary pollutant affecting daily conditions.

pages.title: In These Connecticut Cities, Air Quality Has Reached Elevated Levels

pages.description: Air quality conditions across parts of Connecticut show elevated AQI readings, largely driven by fine particle pollution.
PM2.5 is the dominant pollutant affecting air quality in these cities, contributing most to current AQI levels.

pages.title: West Hartford
pages.description: West Hartford is reporting an AQI of 61, with PM2.5 as the primary pollutant influencing air quality conditions.

pages.title: Waterbury
pages.description: Waterbury currently shows an AQI of 59, as elevated PM2.5 concentrations continue to impact the air.

pages.title: East Hartford
pages.description: East Hartford has an AQI reading of 56, driven mainly by increased levels of PM2.5 in the air.

pages.title: Hartford
pages.description: Hartford is recording an AQI of 52, with PM2.5 remaining the most significant air pollutant.

pages.title: New Britain
pages.description: New Britain is also reporting an AQI of 52, where PM2.5 levels are contributing most to air quality concerns.

pages.title: Meriden
pages.description: Meriden shows a live AQI of 49, with PM2.5 still the leading pollutant affecting air conditions.
Air quality levels can change throughout the day, so residents are encouraged to monitor real time AQI updates and limit exposure when pollution rises.
